medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two days prior to admission with a painless red macule on the proximal medial aspect of the left upper extremity, which became increasingly edematous, evolved into a papule, and produced slight serous drainage over 24 hours. The infant remained afebrile and without apparent pain. By hospital day 2, significant swelling and redness were noted, and systemic symptoms developed including fever and thrombocytopenia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother visited workplace (a national television news organization) shortly before the onset of symptoms; anthrax spores were later found at this location.
medical_history.social_history: Recently played outdoors in a New York park.
